caption:
This photograph features a joyful young child with curly hair, smiling broadly. The child, who appears to be seated, is wearing a white T-shirt. In the child's lap is a doll with distinct facial features, including large eyes and red lips. The doll is dressed in a dress adorned with images of trains and has a pin that reads "Tracks Are Back!" in a circular white badge with red text and border. The child's arm gently surrounds the doll, indicating a feeling of affection or possession.

The background of the photograph is minimally detailed but suggests an interior setting with light gray or tan elements, possibly inside a vehicle given the window beside them.

The overall mood of the image is cheerful and innocent, capturing a moment of childlike happiness and companionship with the doll. The lighting in the photograph is soft, enhancing the gentle, endearing qualities of the scene.
title: Young girl shows off her doll on the Southwest Limited which sports a pin proclaiming "Tracks are back!" It and trains in the U.S. are the responsibility of Amtrak which leases use of the tracks from the nation's railroads. It is an attempt to upgrade railroad passenger service and develop an alternative to the auto as a means of travel.
